episodes.title: A Kid Named Hitler, Snap #805 - Notorious
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
On his very first day of college, Joe swore he heard something that he couldn’t possibly have heard...  

 

If you want to learn about more people named Hitler, check out director Matt Ogen’s fascinating documentary “Meet The Hitlers,” in which he interviews Hitlers from all over the world.  It’s currently available on Showtime, iTunes, and Amazon.  For more information on his upcoming projects, including documentary about a high school on the US-Mexico border and a new documentary series about fighting culture around the world, be sure to check out mattogens.com.  You can also follow Matt on Twitter and Instagram.

 

Producer: Joe Rosenberg


Original Score: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: A Loan Shark's Debt, Snap #805 - Notorious
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
How do go from the heyday to mayday of payday loans?

Special thanks to Gary Rivlin, a reporting fellow with The Investigative Fund for bringing this story to Snap Judgment. For more info, check out Gary’s story in The Intercept.

You can also contact Phil at his email address

 

Producer: Davey Kim

Original Score: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Power: From The Mouths Of The Occupied, Snap #805 - Notorious
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
This was included in the Seattle production of Power: From the Mouths of the Occupied, which features stories from Black community members impacted by state violence as a means to heal. To learn more about Power From the Mouths of the Occupied, and the work of Patrisse Cullors check out her website. If you want to hear more from Luzviminda, check out her talk show.

 

Producer: Patrisse Cullors and C. Davida Ingram

episodes.title: Snap #805 - Notorious
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Notorious." More money, more problems, more stories than you know what to do with. Throw your hands in the air if you're a true player.

episodes.title: Katie v. Katie, Snap #804 - One In A Million
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Katie Crouch learned there was another Katie Crouch who lived in the same city and apparently had the same professional interests as her she thought, huh, what else do we have in common? She would soon find out.  

This story was done in collaboration with Ozy.com, the online magazine that published both Katies’ essays:

The Other Me

Doppelgangers Unite?

Katie Crouch continues to virtually cross paths with her name twin from her new city of Chicago, where she works for an educational publisher, raises a toddler on her own, and writes a blog. Check it out at www.thesolomamaproject.com.

Katie Crouch is a New York Times best selling novelist. Her books include Girls in Trucks and Abroad, among others. She is currently working on a thriller about doppelgängers. Not really.

Maybe.

 

Producer: Nancy López

Original Score: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: 7 Degrees of Canadian Bacon, Snap #804 - One In A Million
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn discovers just how small the world is...

 

Producer: Mark Ristich

episodes.title: Struck By Lighting, Snap #804 - One In A Million
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What happens when you can’t escape your worst enemy?  

A longer version of this story originally aired on the Outside Podcast, from Outside magazine. Their first season investigates the Science of Survival and is supported by PRX and the Alfred P Sloan Foundation.

To hear more episodes from the Outside podcast, find them on iTunes or visit their website at outsideonline.com/podcast.

Producer: Peter Frick-Wright and Robbie Carver

Production Assistance: Liz Mak

Original Score and Sound Design: Robbie Carver

episodes.title: Snap #804 - One In A Million

episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."One In A Million." There is lots of stuff that is never supposed to happen, but once in a while, something slips through the cracks.

When Glynn must become the crossing guard, it isn't all it's cracked up to be.

episodes.title: Snap #630 - Dirty Work
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap... "Dirty Work."  You know how bad it looks, and it's not gonna get any easier, but you roll up your sleeves and get down to it.

episodes.title: The Boy Who Made Waves, Snap #803 - Run For It
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Joe Blair is a pipe fitter in Iowa who writes in his spare time.  He is the father of four, including one autistic son—Michael--who has been both a source of joy and a source of stress.    

 

This story was brought to us by Modern Love: the Podcast, a collaboration between The New York Times and WBUR Boston.  It takes essays from the paper’s popular Sunday column and matches them with top talent from the stage and screen. Mykelti Williamson, who played "Bubba" in Forrest Gump and most recently Gabriel in the Oscar-nominated film "Fences" reads Joe Blair's essay "For The Boy Who Makes Waves."

 

For more incredible stories of modern Love, go visit the Modern Love website and subscribe to their podcast.  

 

Then check out Joe Blair’s memoir, By The Iowa Sea, about the joys and sorrows of life on the great plains.

 

And don’t forget to go see Mykelti Williamson in Fences, directed by Denzel Washington.  It’s in theaters now.    


Original Score: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: The Secret Life of Katherine Ann Power, Snap #803 - Run For It
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What happens when you decide to keep a secret for a really long time...And then, you decide to tell.

 

To learn more about Katherine’s experience, check out her book Doing Time: Papers from Framingham Prison

 

Producer: Adizah Eghan


Original Score: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Speed Sisters, Snap #803 - Run For It
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Marah is the best racer on the Speed Sisters team--the first all-female racing collective in the Arab world. That is, until Betty joins the team.

 

This story is a collaboration with Amber Fares, director of the documentary Speed Sisters. Be sure to check this amazing film out--either at your local theater or on iTunes. You can also find the soundtrack on iTunes here.

 

Our translators are:

Amber Fares, as Marah

Jazmin Aguilera, as Betty

Avery Trufelman, as Maysoon

Mark Ristich, as Marah’s dad

Pat Mesiti-Miller, as Khaled

 

Producer: Eliza Smith


Sound Production: Leon Morimoto

episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap "Run For It." You can walk, amble, stride, but if you really want something...you better run.

W.C. Jameson has searched for a recovered buried treasure across the world. But on a search in Arizona, he found something he never expected. Find out more about W.C. Jameson’s work and adventures at http://www.wcjameson.com/

episodes.title: Number One Boy, Snap #624 - Brass Ring

episodes.summary:
In Brooklyn before it was hip, back in the days when Williamsburg was still rough and the mob ran Red Hook, this is where Lou Diaz learned how to hustle as a young boy. It was on these same streets that this hustle would be particularly handy in a totally different way than he ever expected.


Producer: Julia Dewitt

episodes.summary:

Performed at Snap Judgment Live! at the Nourse Theater in San Francisco

episodes.title: Snap #624 - Brass Ring

episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios

What's it like to be pulling the levers, twisting the plot, and making the tough cuts inside the Snap story factory?   Snap presents "The Specialist," a podcast about work we don't think about and the people who do it. 

Hosted by Casey Miner, a project of KALW public radio in San Francisco.

www.specialistpodcast.com

episodes.title: The Outbreak, Snap #802 - Mirrors
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What do you do when a life-threatening disease makes it too dangerous to save the person closest to you?

Dr. Phillip Ireland was a physician at JFK Hospital in Liberia during the virulent outbreak of Ebola in 2014 when families were torn apart by the runaway virus.

Producer: Jake Halpern

Original Score: Renzo Gorrio
Special thanks to Yale NGN.
Additonal assistance: Mark Ristich, Anna Sussman, Adizah Eghan and Eliza Smith

For more on the work of producer Jake Halpern go to http://www.jakehalpern.com .

episodes.title: Snap Presents Shannon Cason's "Homemade Stories: The Struggle is Real"
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: In this one-hour special, "Homemade Stories: The Struggle is Real," award-winning storyteller Shannon Cason takes us on a journey that finds hope in struggle. From navigating Detroit’s overwhelmed criminal justice system, to searching for work and finding closed doors, to being a father after failing in marriage, to finding anchors in a sea of uncertainty, Shannon's stories are heartfelt, heartbreaking and hilarious all at once.

episodes.title: How Can You Cut This?, Snap #732 - Look Back Special 2016
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Audio editing is a cruel sport. The Snap producers present their "little darlings" that they love, but never got to see the light of day.

Featuring: Pat Mesiti-Miller, Liz Mak, Eliza Smith, Nancy Lopez

Produced by: Davey Kim

Find out about the work David Good is doing at https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Good-Project/375077895861211

Producer: Anna Sussman with assistance from Beth Morgan

episodes.title: Close Shave, Snap #732 - Look Back Special 2016

episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: Go, go, go. Push, push, push. That's all well and good, but every once in a while it's time to kick back and look at what you already did.  The Snap Judgment 2016 Look Back Special.

episodes.title: Third King, Snap #731 - Mettle
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What happens when history calls on you to step up? We go to Standing Rock to find out.

Lance King is an Oglala Lakota Headsman from Pine Ridge Reservation in South Dakota. For more information on his grandfather, Matthew H. King, check out “Noble Red Man: Lakota Wisdomkeeper Matthew King.” 

 

Producer: Liz Mak

Score and Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Wonderboy, Snap #731 - Mettle
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
In 1979, a four-seater cessna carrying Norman Ollestad, his dad and his dad’s girlfriend violently crashed onto the top of an ~8,000-foot mountain. He was just 11 years old.

 

To learn more about Norman’s story, check out his book -- Crazy for the Storm. Be sure to also check out his latest thriller, French Girl With Mother.


Producer and Original Score: Davey Kim

episodes.title: Electric Fence, Snap #731 - Mettle
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
As a country boy, Glynn puts his family pride on the line when his neighbor challenges him to the ultimate test of manhood.


Score by: Leon Morimoto and Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.summary:
For 10-year-old Greg Williams, life  was good...until the day his mom left.

 

To learn more about Greg’s story, check out his book Life on the Color Line.

 

Producer: Adizah Eghan

episodes.summary: It's an all-new Snap…"Mettle." Luck is nice, good fortune fantastic, but sometimes you have to show what you are made of.

Jesse de la Cruz knew had had two choices in life, he could either be a farm hand like or his dad or he could be like Big Indio.

At five years old, Kooshyar Karimi learns a secret about his family that could get him imprisoned or killed. But of course, no secret remains secret forever. Find out more about Kooshyar Karimi here.

Everyone wants to be an object of desire... until you desire not to be an object.

episodes.summary: On the next Snap, "Cross To Bear." You don't want it, you didn't create it, but it's all yours.

episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios

In 2009, Jane Gillooly came across an item on Ebay that piqued her imagination.  The picture was of a suitcase filled with old audiotapes.  The listing’s title was “Suitcase of Love and Shame.”

 

You can purchase Jane’s feature-length documentary film, Suitcase of Love and Shame, on iTunes and learn more about it at Cinemaguild.

What if one day you found out you look like one of the most famous people in the country -- who everybody hates?

Lynn Harris is an author, commentator, award-winning journalist and mostly-retired comedian. She has a new business, teaching comedy to teenage girls. You can find her performing on stage as Tonya Harding here.

 

Producer : Liz Mak

episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios

After a whirlwind romance, Brian and Vanessa get married and move to Kinshasa. Everything is going well until she shows up.

Thanks to Vanessa Woods for sharing her story. Love Rival was produced by Mira Burt-Wintonick  and Cristal Duhaime with Jodie Taylor You can hear more at cbc.ca/loveme or subscribe on iTunes. Click here to listen to more of Jodie's work.

episodes.title: Snap #730 - Rivals

episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Rivals." It's always that person you can't stand who pushes you to be better.

episodes.title: Snap #625 - Sleeping Girl
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What if you could live forever--but you had to be asleep the whole time? Would you want to live your life… in a dream?

This story was commissioned by Serendipity, an audio fiction podcast produced by Ann Heppermann and Martin Johnson from Sarah Lawrence College. "Sleeping Girl" was inspired by The Sarah Awards' Very, Very, Short Short Stories Contest. Learn more at thesarahawards.com. There you can listen to inspiring works, learn how to take part in the audio fiction revolution.

 

Actors

Sleeping Girl - Katie Mingle

Her Partner - Eliza Smith

 

Producer: Eliza Smith

Written By Eliza Smith and Mark Ristich

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

For more info, check out Daniel Barbarisi’s story in the Wall Street Journal.

Producer: Davey Kim

episodes.title: Snap #625 - Low Blow
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Rodney Hyden was a hardworking family man. He liked to end his week surrounded by good friends, a bonfire, and an old fella by the name of Julian who liked to spin a tall tale involving buried cocaine off the shores of Puerto Rico. But it was just a story, right?

The story was created as part of a collaboration between Snap Judgment and GQ magazine. It was produced by Nancy López along with Daniel Riley, who first reported Rodney’s story, The Great Cocaine Treasure Hunt, for GQ.

Producer: Nancy Lopez

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

Glynn was almost a Globetrotter….almost.

episodes.summary: Some people go through life with a smile on their faces...do they know something we don't? On the next Snap, "Rose Colored Glasses."

episodes.title: Snap Special - Gratitude 2015
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: It's an extra helping of stuffing..."Gratitude 2015" encore presentation. Even now, Snap still has a whole lot to be thankful for.  So pass the gravy, and thanks for listening.

episodes.title: Perfect Boyfriend, Snap #725 - Gratitude 2016
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When she was a teenager, Beverly’s dad never approved of anyone she dated. Then she met Dwayne…

To learn more about Beverly, you can check out her website: www.beverlygooden.com

Producer: Joe Rosenberg

episodes.title: Skin Deep, Snap #725 - Gratitude 2016
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
It’s days before the big dance at Camp Discovery...and there’s a problem, a few problems. And the kids at this camp are more used to problems than your average camper.

Camp Discovery is sponsored by the American Academy of Dermatology. It's free. It's a lot of fun. And you can learn more about it by going to www.aad.org and searching for "Camp Discovery."

Producer: Sarah Harris, edited by Anna Sussman

episodes.title: Channel B, Snap #725 - Gratitude 2016
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Megan had just welcomed her son into the world. She was supposed to be happy, right? Overjoyed, right? But Megan felt… empty. 

"Channel B" was first written and performed for the 2nd Story storytelling series. It was first published at The Rumpus and later included in The Best American Essays 2013. You can also find it in Stielstra's recent essay collection, Once I Was Cool. For all things Megan Stielstra, visit http://www.meganstielstra.com/

Producer: Eliza Smith

episodes.title: Unbowed Unbent, Snap #725 - Gratitude 2016
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn witnesses the fall of a Malaysian dignitary.

Producer: Mark Ristich

episodes.title: Snap #725 - Gratitude 2016
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap Judgment, "Gratitude 2016." Even after the rain, there are still rainbows.

episodes.title: Cyntoia And The Prosecutor, Snap #729 - Inside Scoop
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Although one is an inmate and the other is a prosecutor, Cyntoia Brown and Preston Shipp were never supposed to cross paths. But their paths did cross, not once but twice.  

For more on Cyntoia Brown’s story make sure to watch Dan Birman’s documentary: Me Facing Life.

 

Producer: Nancy Lopez

Score and Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Mohamed v. The War On Terror, Snap #729 - Inside Scoop
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
If you're a Syrian citizen named Mohamad Al-Baghdadi, immediately after 9/11 might not be the best time to board a plane without your green card. But Mohamad thinks, "Hey, what's the big deal?" He's about to find out . . .

Producers: Glynn Washington and Stephanie Foo

episodes.title: Ardour, Snap #729 - Inside Scoop
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Turns out, winter isn’t coming. This radio play is an adaptation of Jonathan Keats’s story, Ardour, which is featured in the story collection, My mother she killed me, my father, he ate me, edited by Kate Bernhemer. You can find more from Jonathan Keats here:

 

Narrator: Adizah Eghan

Producer: Eliza Smith

episodes.title: Granny and Glynn, Snap #729 - Inside Scoop
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn's grandma regales Glynn with her past.

Producer: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: Snap #729 - Inside Scoop
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Inside Scoop." The secret handshake, the password, the hidden deals, they can all be elusive...but on the next Snap Judgment we let you in the inner circle.

episodes.title: Marwencol, Snap #626 - The Proxy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Mark Hogancamp woke up in the hospital he had no idea who he was or where he was. He was beat up so badly that he couldn’t walk, talk or speak. When his therapies are cut off by Medicaid, Mark has to make his own treatment, and in the process he makes some most unusual friends. 

Once you’ve listened, we know you want to see the photos. And lucky for you you can find them all in one book. Welcome to Marwencolcomes out November 3rd. Do not miss it. Go to the website to get yourself a copy. You can find the documentary on which this story was based, Marwencol, there too. HUGE thank you to Jeff Malmberg, the director of the documentary, for sharing his tape with us for this story.


Producer: Julia DeWitt

episodes.title: Friday Night Lights, Snap #626 - The Proxy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Your dad loves football. You hate football. How do you quit? Play football.

Check out Harrison’s memoir -- The World Largest Man

Producer: Davey Kim
Sound Designer: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Just Another Fish Story, Snap #626 - The Proxy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
20 Years ago, a whale washed up on a beach in Lubec, Maine, but it’s death was just the beginning of it’s story.  

This piece was produced by Molly Menschel when she was a student at the Salt Institute in Portland Maine.  Salt Institute is the one place that trained budding radio producers nation-wide, and is currently in danger of closing.    To find out more about efforts to keep the school open, you can visit savesalt.org and join Save Salt’s facebook page.

The Music on this story is played with the jew's harp by Tapani Varis, if you like to hear more go to www.tapanivaris.com.

Producer: Molly Menschel

episodes.title: Liar Liar, Snap #626 - The Proxy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn must settle a mock lawsuit with his partner to pass his class. His tactics are ruthless.

Producer: Mark Ristich

episodes.title: Snap #626 - The Proxy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap ..."The Proxy." What if you could be you without all of the responsibility, the guilt, and the self-loathing? Too good to be true? ...Maybe not.

episodes.title: Big Al, Snap 728 - Spooked VII: Pitch Black
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Before he went to medical school, Don Clark worked with developmentally-delayed patients in a group home in Philly. That job opened his eyes, and challenged everything he believed about life, and death.

 

Producer: Eliza Smith

 

Original Score & Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: The Phantom Border Patrol Agent, Snap 728 - Spooked VII: Pitch Black
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Rocky Elmore became a Border Patrol Agent along the US-Mexico border, he knew it would be a scary job … just not this scary.

For more stories of natural and supernatural happenings on the border, be sure to check out Rocky’s book, Out On Foot: Nightly Patrols and Ghostly Tales of A U.S. Border Patrol Agent (https://www.amazon.com/Out-Foot-Nightly-Patrols-Ghostly/dp/0692488383) and his website (http://rockyelmore.com/).

 

Original Score: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: The Boy Named Thomas, Snap 728 - Spooked VII: Pitch Black
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Shane Dunphy spent years working with kids as a social worker. And he’d seen it all, or at least that’s what he thought until he met a little boy named Gregory.

For more, be sure to grab a copy of Shane Dunphy’s book The Boy They Tried to Hide.

 

Producer: Nancy López

Original Score & Sound Design: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: Snap #728 - Spooked VII: Pitch Black
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On an all-NEW Snap..."Spooked VII: Pitch Black." There is the dark of night...and then there is darkness so deep you can barely hear yourself scream. The hair-raising finale of Snap's terrifying "Spooked Week" of haunting, true-life stories. Be afraid . . .

episodes.title: Snap Spooked Special - Sight Unseen
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap Spooked Special..."Sight Unseen." When the lights go dark...how can you be sure you're alone?  Part of Snap's terrifying "Spooked Week" of haunting, true-life stories. Be afraid . . .

episodes.title: Snap Spooked Special - Hounds Of Hell
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap Spooked Special... "Hounds of Hell." What happens when man's best friend...turns into your worst enemy? Part of Snap's terrifying "Spooked Week" of haunting, true-life stories. Be afraid . . .

episodes.title: Unicorn Prince, Snap Spooked Special - Welcome To The Dollhouse
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Maria always got double the presents on Christmas because her birthday was the next day. But there was one present she always looked forward to most: her aunt's present. Every year, Maria's aunt bought her a doll for her doll collection. So when the day rolled around Maria was a senior in high school she opened her aunt's present first. Low and behold it was another doll. But this doll was unlike any Maria had ever seen. And she would never want to see it again.

Producer: Julia DeWitt

episodes.title: The House That Granny Built, Snap Spooked Special - Welcome To The Dollhouse
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Ali came home one night after foot surgery and was shocked. Her grandmother was waiting in the living room with a gift -- a dollhouse.

Be sure to check out Ali Standish’ website, facebook and twitter


Producer and Sound Design: Davey Kim

episodes.title: Snap Spooked Special -  Welcome To The Dollhouse
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap Spooked Special...."Welcome To The Dollhouse." Sometimes the most innocent things...are the scariest. Part of Snap's terrifying "Spooked Week" of haunting, true-life stories. Be afraid . . .

episodes.title: Snap #727 - Campfire Tales III
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: When the fire crackles and the shadows dance -- get ready for Snap Judgment's "Campfire Tales." Part of Snap's terrifying "Spooked Week" of haunting, true-life stories. Be afraid . . .

episodes.title: Pastor's Oil, Snap #727 - Campfire Tales III
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn’s friend Jenny is sick.  Up in her room, she’s shaking like there’s something inside of her. And Glynn is about to find out what . . . 

Story by Glynn Washington. Produced by Stephanie Foo.

episodes.title: See No Evil by Chandra Sivakumar, Snap #727 - Campfire Tales III
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Chandra Sivakumar's family turns to the powers of a dark priest to lift the curse paralyzing his aunt.

Produced by Stephanie Foo and Glynn Washington

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When friends get together for a little childhood fun, things get real. Fast. To hear the original full length version that first appeared on KCRW’s UnFictional, check out their webpage.

 

Producer: Bob Carlson

episodes.title: Hot Water, Snap #727 - Campfire Tales III
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: When friends get together for a little childhood fun, things get real. Fast. To hear the original full length version that first appeared on KCRW’s UnFictional, check out their webpage.

episodes.title: The Blacktop Slide, Snap #726 - Down With The Ship
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Tara’s softball team was not afraid to shed a little blood in the ultimate game of boys v.s. girls.

This story was recorded live at Sideshow Goshkosideshowgoshko.blogspot.com, a New York Times “Critic Pick” storytelling series that takes place the 4th Thursday of every month at the KGB Bar in Manhattan.

Big news, Tara Clancy has a brand new memoir out!  It's called "The Clancy's of Queens."  Get it here:  www.TaraClancy.com

Producer: Ana Adlerstein

episodes.title: This Will Be The Day That I Die: The Sinking Of The Cruiseship Oceanos - Snap #726 - Down With The Ship
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Let Moss Hills take you on sea cruise …     

 

To learn more about the sinking of the Oceanos, be sure to check out: http://www.oceanossinking.com/

 

And you like that, you definitely won’t want to miss the video of the ship’s final moments:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nfIZ6rcySuY

 

Producer: Joe Rosenberg

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Brother's Keeper, Snap #726 - Down With The Ship
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Bill Babbitt realizes that his brother Manny has committed a crime, he must figure out what to do. Will he call the police, or get him a bus ticket out of town?

Bill Babbitt finds himself responsible for his brother after he returns from the Vietnam War.

Check out the documentary Last Day of Freedom. The film was directed by Nomi Talisman and Dee Hibbert-Jones

http://www.lastdayoffreedom.net/

 

Producer: Adizah Eghan

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Stage Bombing, Snap #726 - Down With The Ship
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn faces a great fear.

Producer: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: Snap #726 - Down With The Ship
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Down With The Ship." There are two kinds of people, those who try to survive...and those who dance as the water rises

episodes.title: About Face, Snap #617 - Tin Man
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
You’ve heard the saying, right? You can’t see the forest for the trees. Well, imagine if your whole life all you could do, all you knew how to do, was see the trees, the details, the minutiae of the world. What would you miss out on. Let’s take a walk in Tom Conces’ shoes and find out.

Producer: Nancy López
Original score: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Scientist and The Psychopath, Snap #617 - Tin Man
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Neuroanatomist Dr. James Fallon studies the most dangerous kind of person: the psychopath. His job is to get up close and personal with the mind of the psychopath so that we can better understand what makes them tick. He treats their brains with the cold calculation of a scientist at work. But in the process things get mighty personal.

James Fallon, PhD is a neuroanatomist and geneticist at UC-Irvine. For more about his work and his own life, check out his book here:The Psychopath Inside: A Neuroscientist's Personal Journey into the Dark Side of the Brain: James Fallon.

Producer: Julia DeWitt
Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: If I Only Had A Heart, Snap #617 - Tin Man
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
The sum of the parts cannot equal the hole in your heart.

Producer: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: Snap #617 - Tin Man
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap..."Tin Man." What if you were born without a heart? Featuring stories about the DMZ, face blindness, and psychopaths.

episodes.title: Snap Special - The Polaroid Phantom
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Can't wait for Spooked 7? Try this... a classic ghost story with photographic evidence. Two men living outside of Los Angeles encounter a ghost so undeniable, they have to fight back the press and the rest of the world to maintain their sanity.

See the pics for yourself:  www.seeingthingsthebook.com

Also see pics here.

Producer: Anna Sussman
Sound design: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: Girl In The Dark, Snap #724 - End Of The Rainbow
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Anna Lyndsey first felt the burning sensation on her skin she figured she’d go to a dermatologist and get a quick fix. But she quickly learned there was no such thing. The lengths she would have to go to find relief went beyond her worst nightmare.

Make sure to pick up a copy of Anna Lyndsey’s memoir: Girl in the Dark. And for an update on her condition check out her blog: Back to the Light.

 

Producer: Nancy López

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: The Dog That Went Around The World, Snap #724 - End Of The Rainbow
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
The story of the first dog to travel around the world (and refuse a free steak).

For more information on Owney's travels, be sure to check out the Post Office Museum's interactive map (http://postalmuseum.si.edu/exhibits/current/moving-the-mail/mail-by-rail/owney-mascot-of-the-railway-mail-service/all-about-owney/owneys-travel-usa-canada.html).  But brace yourself, there's a lot of pins...

Producer: Joe Rosenberg

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Rainbow Road, Snap #724 - End Of The Rainbow
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: Glynn takes a ride with his family...to a destination he would never expect.

episodes.title: Bionic Blondes, Snap #724 - End Of The Rainbow
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
The hottest alien takeover of all time. This story was originally written by Kelly Link, and comes from her collection, Stranger Things Happen. It was adapted, directed, and produced by Mark Ristich and Eliza Smith.

Voice Actors: Glynn Washington and Joyce Lee

You can find all things Kelly Link at her website, http://kellylink.net/

episodes.title: Snap #724 - End Of The Rainbow
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap... "End Of The Rainbow." We all want a world where what we imagine comes to pass, but sometimes, you can't escape reality.

episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios

What’s the easiest way to make money? Make Money. And lots of it.

Check out Frank’s work here

Producer: Davey Kim
Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: The Faith Healer, Snap #723 - My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Imagine putting your hands on someone, and curing whatever ails them. Charles Monroe Kane knows the feeling. 

Charles Monroe Kane is a host on To The Best of Our Knowledge on Wisconsin Public Radio. You can also find his new book, Lithium Jesus: A Memoir of Mania, on Amazon and Audible.com. 

Producer: Eliza Smith
Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Forbidden Fruit, Snap #723 - My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
An aspiring priest decides to experience all that the world has to offer.

Producer: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: Snap #723 - My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy." Sometimes the only word you hear is "No." But what if you always said "Yes"?

episodes.title: Lake Chronicopia, Snap #621 - Crash and Burn
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Dale Bard was a young rock climber in Yosemite in the 1970s. Back then, rock climbing was an obscure passion, endeavored by only the most daring and intrepid young adventurers. But these young adventurers needed a way to eat and buy meager supplies. And they came across the most unbelievable cash cow you’ve ever heard of.

Producer: Julia Dewitt and Anna Sussman

episodes.title: Lucky 8-Ball, Snap #621 - Crash and Burn
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Every week, without fail, Jupiter Diego and his wife would go to couples therapy and then treat themselves to a nice dinner out. But on this particular evening things didn’t go exactly as planned. 

This story was adapted from Whit Missildine’s podcast This Is Actually Happening, featuring stories about what happens when everything changes. You can listen to episodes on their website or subscribe to their podcast on iTunes.

 

For more, check out Jupiter’s website: http://www.jupiterdiego.com/ 


Producer: Whit Missildine

episodes.title: Trading Places, Snap #621 - Crash And Burn
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Jared Dillian was 23, working for the coast guard, scanning the sea’s horizon he had his sights set on only one thing: getting to Wall Street and becoming a stud trader. What he didn’t know was how much it would cost him.

To learn about Jared’s other exploits on Wall Street make sure to pick up a copy of his book - Street Freak: Money and Madness at Lehman Brothers. You can also check out his financial newsletter, The Daily Dirtnap - http://www.dailydirtnap.com/

 

Producer: Nancy López

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Snap #621 - Crash And Burn
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
On the next Snap..."Crash and Burn." Riveting stories from people who pushed it to the limit.

Snap Judgment, storytelling with a BEAT.

episodes.title: True Friends, Snap #722 - Blood Oath
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn discovers the true meaning of friendship.

Producer: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: The Belfast Project, Snap #722 - Blood Oath
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
It’s not always easy to deal with the past, especially if it’s a troubled one. Do you hold on to it or do you let it go? For Anthony McIntyre the answer was easy.

Anthony McIntyre is a journalist and you can check out his writings on his website: The Pensive Quill.

Thank you to Ed Moloney for sharing the archival tape of the Brendan Hughes interviews from the Belfast Project that were featured in his book, Voices from the Grave.

And to learn more about the Belfast Project subpoenas check out this link: https://bostoncollegesubpoena.wordpress.com

Producer: Nancy Lopez

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Love At No Sight from CBC's "Love Me", Snap #722 - Blood Oath
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Two best friends have never met in person ... and one of them insists they keep it that way.

That was Allison Williams, and that piece was produced by Mira Burt-Wintonick  and Cristal Duhaime for CBC's Love Me. You can hear more at cbc.ca/loveme or subscribe on iTunes.

episodes.title: Snap #722 - Blood Oath
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Blood Oath." Some commitments go way beyond words. Amazing stories of friendship and betrayal.

episodes.title: Snap Featured Fiction - 13 Ways of Destroying a Painting
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
How far would you go to save the person you love? This radio play was adapted from Amber Sparks’s story, 13 Ways of Destroying a Painting, from her short story collection The Unfinished World. You can find more of her work at www.ambernoellesparks.com

 

Narrator: Thao Nguyen of Thao and the Get Down Stay Down

Director: Mark Ristich

Producer: Eliza Smith

Sound Design: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: Switched On, Snap #721 - Fortress of Solitude
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Imagine spending the first four decades of your life in darkness. Then imagine that someone suddenly switches the lights on.

 

John Elder Robison is a writer, speaker and advocate for people with autism. Be sure to check out his neurodiversity work at the College of William and Mary as well as his car restoration work at Robison Services.

 

Producer and Sound Design: Davey Kim

episodes.title: Quiet Place, Snap #721 - Fortress of Solitude
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: When Glynn needs to think, he goes to a place no one can reach him.

episodes.title: Jay J. Armes: Private Eye, Snap #721 - Fortress of Solitude
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Jay J. Armes was a real life superhero ... until real life intruded.  

Also be sure to check out Gary Cartwright’s original 1976 article on Jay J. Armes for Texas Monthly. http://www.texasmonthly.com/articles/is-jay-j-armes-for-real/

 

Producer: Vanessa Rancano

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Snap #721 - Fortress Of Solitude
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Fortress of Solitude." When the world becomes too much, you need a safe place to regroup.

episodes.title: Shot In The Dark, Snap #613 - Weight Of The World
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Growing up David Jackson knew one thing, that he would never be like his dad.

 

This story was adapted from Whit Missildine’s podcast This Is Actually Happening, featuring stories about what happens when everything changes. You can listen to episodes on their website or subscribe to their podcast on iTunes.

Producer: Whit Missildine
Co-producer: Nancy López
Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Out Of Uniform, Snap #613 - Weight Of The World
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn wants to join the boy scouts, but there is one thing in his way.

Producer: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: The Red Lantern, Snap #613 - Weight Of The World
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What drives a man across the middle of the frozen tundra?

Listen as Jeff Greenwald performs "The Red Lantern" for the event "That Actually Happened" at the Monkey House Theater in Berkeley, CA. For more info on writer Jeff Greenwald (and to purchase his books!) visit JeffGreenwald.com

episodes.title: The Recipients, Snap #613 - Weight Of The World
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Cynthia McCabe was checking through her email one last time before she went to bed when she noticed a strange email caught her attention. She opened it and started reading. “I’m an American ex-pat writer,” it said, “and this is my last day on Earth.”

Producer: Julia DeWitt

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Snap #613 - Weight Of The World

episodes.summary: On the next Snap ... "Weight Of The World." Everyone has a secret. Some secrets are heavier than others.

episodes.title: Radioactive Boy Scout, Snap 720 - Nuclear Family
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
David was a high school kid who thought that he could change the world by pioneering the development of nuclear energy. But he didn’t want to wait until graduation -- David figured he'd start his nuclear reactor at the age of 15.

Ken Silverstein is an investigative journalist based in D.C.  He wrote the book, The Radioactive Boy Scout, upon which this story is based.  Thanks also to Harper’s Magazine and Emile Klein for this story.

Producer: Stephanie Foo

episodes.title: GSA, Snap 720 - Nuclear Family
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Sue was adopted at birth. As an adult, she found her biological family, and when she met her half-brother Mike, her life changed forever.

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

Producer: Eliza Smith

episodes.title: Opiyo, Snap 720 - Nuclear Family
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Jeannette Quinn first traveled to Uganda in the summer of 2006 she knew it would be an enriching experience. But then she met a little boy named Opiyo Ivan and her life took the most unexpected turn.

Jeannette Quinn has started the Opiyo Ivan Memorial Fund, and proceeds will go to support her organization, AFENDS, which provides services for individuals (and their families) in northern Uganda who suffer from epilepsy or nodding disease/syndrome.

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

Producer: Nancy López

episodes.title: Future Child, Snap 720 - Nuclear Family
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What would your children say, before they could even speak?

Sound Design: Pat Mesiti-Miller

Story: Glynn Washington

episodes.title: Snap #720 - Nuclear Family
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: One mom, one dad, 2.5 kids and a white picket fence?  This week on Snap Judgment we get real.  From WNYC Studios, Snap proudly presents..."Nuclear Family."

episodes.title: Snap Special - Texas vs. Texas
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Joe Rowe lived happily in the middle of the West Texas desert - until a stranger named Rick McLaren moved in and started a violent militia group called the Republic of Texas. Things got downright ugly when McLaren sent troops to take Joe hostage in his own home.

Check out some behind-the-scenes footage of Joe showing off bullet holes in his home! Right here at Snap Films!

Producer: Stephanie Foo

episodes.title: Been There, Better Than That, Snap 719 - Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn witnesses a lady show what real class looks like.

Producer: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: 12 Pageant Queens, 1000 Snakes, Snap 719 - Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
One Beauty Pageant. 12 contestants. 1500 rattlesnakes.


Producer: Anna Sussman

episodes.title: A Hard Knock Life, Snap 719 - Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Sharon Skolnick was nine years old and an orphan in the Murrow Indian Orphanage, when she was confronted with the opportunity every girl at the orphanage dreamed of. Find out more about artist Sharon Skolnick at here.

 

Producer: Anna Sussman

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Xiao Xiao, Snap 719 - Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Cindy adopted a four year old girl from China, there was a lot the two didn’t understand about each other.

Find out about Cindy’s story (and her books) at CindyChampnella.com.

Producer: Anna Sussman

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Snap #719 - Big Girls Don't Cry
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Big Girls Don't Cry." When the going gets tough, the tough make stuff happen. Featuring stories about rattlesnakes pageant queens, Apache orphans, and the legendary Xiao Xiao.

episodes.title: Snap Special - As The World Burns
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When the world around you is burning, where do you look for relief?

Performed live by Josh Healey at Snap LIVE!

Music composed by Alex Mandel and performed by Alex Mandel, Tim Frick, and David Brandt

episodes.title: Snap Special - Glynn's Interview with Benjamen Walker's Theory of Everything
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: Glynn Washington tells us what it's like to grow up black in a white supremacist Jesus Cult (the Worldwide Church of God).   This interview was produced by Benjamen Walker, the host of the podcast the Theory of Everything.

episodes.title: Game Boy, Snap #615 - Caught Up
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn is unsure of his future, so he decides to go for what he likes best: video games.

Producer: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: The Accidental Arms Dealer, Snap #615 - Caught Up
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
A young massage therapist in Miami beach gets the business offer of a lifetime. So he shakes hands with the devil and hopes for the best. Read the whole story in Guy Lawson’s Arms and the Dudes at
 guylawson.com.

Check out his Facebook and Twitter.
 
Check out David Packouz’s newest project, something much more peaceful, at http://mybeatbuddy.com/

Producer: Anna Sussman and Julia Dewitt in collaboration with Guy Lawson.

episodes.title: Eye of the Storm, Snap #615 - Caught Up
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What happens when 24 people shut themselves in a beer cooler to wait out one of the strongest tornadoes in recorded history? Take a listen, because they recorded it.

Check out the original article on the Joplin Beer Cooler from Luke Dittrich for Esquire magazine.


Producer: Anna Sussman and Eliza Smith with Luke Dittrich. Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Snap #615 - Caught Up
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap..."Caught Up." You think you make your own decisions, go your own way, forge your own path, but you look up and realize...you're playing someone else's game.

episodes.title: Past Life Detective, Snap #718 - "Caught Up"
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Detective Bob Snow never could have imagined that the toughest case of his entire        career, would be an investigation into his own past....life.  Check out Bob Snow’s books here.


Producer: Liz Mak

episodes.title: Nahoko Takato: Hero Held Hostage, Snap #718 - Leap of Faith
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
In 2004, aid worker Nahoko Takato was taken hostage in Iraq. When she finally returns back to Japan, she was not prepared for her homecoming.

Check out her work here

Producer and Sound Design: Davey Kim

episodes.title: Sorry Pops, Snap #718 - Leap of Faith
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn is always looking for new ways to disappoint his dad.

Producer: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: Snap #718  - Leap Of Faith
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..." Leap of Faith." When you feel disaster looming, but still...you decide to go for it. Snap Judgment, storytelling with a beat.

episodes.title: Snap Classic - The Orange
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Storyteller Joel ben Izzy tells the hauntingly beautiful story of a simple piece of fruit.

Producer: Stephanie Foo

episodes.title: Fault Lines, Snap #717 - Shake, Rattle, and Roll
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn goes on a date...and things get shaky.

Producer: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: Zim Heavy: Rock and Revolution in Zimbabwe, Snap #717 - Shake, Rattle, and Roll
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Before there was Zimbabwe, there was the “Heavy” scene. In the 1970’s, Rock music rang out from the black townships in Rhodesia. One band, Wells Fargo, became the voice of the people. Founding members Ebba Chitambo and Never Mpofu tell their story of music and revolution in the face of an oppressive government.

 

Wells Fargo’s new release Watch Out! is available now through Vinyl Me Please.

Learn more about the work Matthew Shechmeister and Eothen “Egon” Alapatt are doing to document the Heavy scene at Now-Again Records.  

 

Producer: Pat Mesiti-Miller

Correspondent: Albert Nyathi

Featuring Music by Wells Fargo

Courtesy of Now-Again Records

episodes.title: Snap #717 - Shake, Rattle, and Roll
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap Judgment..."Shake, Rattle, and Roll." What happens when you try to hold your ground, but that same ground crumbles beneath you?

episodes.title: Snap Classic - The Rabbi and the KKK
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
A New York Rabbi has his faith tested when he takes a job in Nebraska. 

Producer: Anna Sussman

episodes.title: With Great Power, Snap #614 - Godsend
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What if a harmless little game you used to play in your living room, ended up giving you real magical powers, magical powers led to an irreversible and terrible chain of events?

Find more of Katie Lippa’s work on her website www.lippalogic.com.

Check out the life and work of Samantha Smithwww.samanthasmith.info/

Producer:Anna Sussman

episodes.title: The Blue Bear, Snap #614 - Godsend
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Lynn Schooler grew up in Alaska hearing rumor after rumor about the elusive blue bear. He never gave it much thought until a friend convinced him they go out searching for one. What Lynn ended up finding was, of course, something much different.

For more on Lynn Schooler’s work check out this website and his Facebook page.

Producer: Nancy Lopez
Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio and Davey Kim

episodes.title: What Accent?, Snap #614 - Godsend
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Ellen Spencer was released from the hospital after a mysterious stroke-like episode her voice would never be the same again.

Producer: Julia DeWitt
Sound Design: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: The Garbage Man, Snap #614 - Godsend
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn's first day at a new school is rough... until he meets a girl who knows how to take out the trash.

Producer: Pat Mesiti Miller

episodes.title: Snap #614 - Godsend
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap, "Godsend." You may have the wisdom of the ages, but when it really hits the fan...even you might need some help. Featuring tales of rare medical phenomenons, mythical creatures, and mind control.

episodes.title: Grits and Sausages, Snap #716 - Voice of Reason
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Ray Christian was a young boy, he longed to hear the voice of God.

Check out his podcast here.

Producer: Davey Kim

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Dine N' Dash, Snap #716 - Voice of Reason
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
In the annals of dining and dashing, only one man ever dared not to dash.

Today, Christina Swarns is the Director of Litigation at the NAACP Legal Defense Fund.  If you want to learn more about what they do (which turns out to be really important and really interesting at the same time) check out their website: http://www.naacpldf.org/

Also be sure to read Rick Bragg’s original article on Gangaram Mahes.

 

Producer: Joe Rosenberg

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Follow the Leader, Snap #716 - Voice of Reason
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn goes to Game 1 of the NBA finals. When he finds himself sitting next to Jesse Jackson, he follows the reverend to the inner circle.

Producer: Pat Mestiti-Miller

episodes.title: Valley of Death - Josh Healey, Snap #716 - Voice of Reason
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Josh Healey guides his veteran friend off the ledge.

Performed Live by Josh Healey at Oakland's Paramount Theater.

Music composed by Alex Mandel and performed by David Brandt, Tim Frick, and Alex Mandel.

episodes.title: Snap #716 - Voice of Reason
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On an all-NEW Snap..."Voice of Reason". What if you discover your plans aren't working? Do you listen to good advice or do you shoot the messenger? Featuring stories about Jesse Jackson, the voice of God, and more...

episodes.title: Cop Out, Snap #612 - Unforgiven
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Ex-Cop Robert Davis had two choices: Show up to court and serve a sentence that meant certain death... or find a way out. Find out about Robert Davis’s work here.

 

Producer: Anna Sussman

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: The Silent Twins, Snap #612 - Unforgiven
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
June and Jennifer Gibbons were twins sisters who hadn’t spoken to anyone but each other for their whole lives. That is, until journalist Marjorie Wallace came along. Marjorie unearthed the twins’ fascinating, and sometimes sinister inner world. 

For more information on the Gibbons twins, check out Marjorie’s book,The Silent Twins. 

Producer: Eliza Smith
Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: The Hijacker's Letter, Snap #612 - Unforgiven
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What do you do when you receive a letter from your husband’s killer?

For more information, check out Kathleen’s website and facebook page.

Producer and Sound Design:Davey Kim

episodes.title: Snap #612 - Unforgiven
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next Snap..."Unforgiven." There is a line, draw it in the sand, shake on it, mark it in blood, but if you cross it... there is no going back.

episodes.title: Sleep No More, Snap #715 - A Loss For Words
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
In a world, where no time is wasted, one man... shuts his eyes.

Our cast, in order of appearance:

Doris: Avery Trufelman

Jack: Joe Rosenberg

Gail: Eliza Smith

Gerry: Mark Ristich

Doctor: Bob Brody

Producer: Eliza Smith & Joe Rosenberg

Sound Design: Leon Morimoto

episodes.title: Romantic Pains by Dhaya Lakshminarayanan, Snap #715 - A Loss For Words
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Beneath the surface of Dhaya's sweet grey haired "patti" lies the turmoil of tradition and tragedy that will not be explained away.

Performed Live at the Paramount Theatre in Oakland

Music Composed by Alex Mandel and performed by Alex Mandel, Tim Frick, and David Brandt

episodes.title: Speechwriter, Snap #715 -A Loss For Words
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When the governor hired Barton to be his speechwriter, Barton thought his words would make a difference.  Then he got back some edits.    

You can watch the full version of the governor’s press conference here. 

Barton Swaim’s memoir is called the Speechwriter.  Check it out.

Producer: Joe Rosenberg

Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Snap #715 - A Loss For Words
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Loss for Words." We know what you wanted to say, what you were trying to say, what you should have said. We really, really do.

episodes.title: Old Time Strong Man, Snap #714 - Man of Steel
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What happens when a five-foot-seven, 42-year-old from Queens makes a career change to become a superhero?

This story comes from the documentary Bending Steel.

Also check out Chris Wonder Schoek and Unconventional Athletes.

Producer: Anna Sussman

episodes.title: The Price of Silence, Snap #714 - Man of Steel
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
How did Ben Holmes disappear, then return with a bang?

Producer: Davey Kim
Sound Design: Renzo Gorrio

episodes.title: Sharp Dressed Man, Snap #714 - Man of Steel
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Glynn discovers discovers who is the man behind the man he really wants to be.

Producer: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: Snap # 714 - Man of Steel
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: On the next all-NEW Snap..."Man of Steel." When an immovable object meets an unstoppable force, what is left standing?

episodes.title: Thank You, Snap Nation!
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: Hear the final results of your hard work.  Big Love from Team Snap!

episodes.title: Fargo, Snap #611 - To The Brink
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
Documentarian Paul Berczeller examines the case of Takako Konishi, who died in a frozen forest on the North Dakota/Minnesota border looking for the fictional treasure from the Coen Brother’s film Fargo.    

Be sure to check out Paul’s documentary about Takako’s journey, This is A True Story.

Also, be sure to check out the new feature film by the David and Nathan Zellner inspired by Takako’s story, Kumiko: The Treasure Hunter. 

It will be available for download on iTunes, Amazon, Google Play and xBox, as well as VOD, on June 19th, and available on DVD on June 30th.

Producer: Joe Rosenberg

episodes.title: The Miniature Wife, Snap #611 - To The Brink
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
What happens when you shrink your wife… literally? Writer Manuel Gonzales brings us a fictional tale of marital mayhem. You can find more of Manuel’s writing at http://miniaturewife.tumblr.com/

Narrator: Thao Nguyen (http://thaoandthegetdownstaydown.com/)
Husband: Sam Fischmann
Wife: Eliza Smith

 
Producer: Eliza Smith
Sound Design: Pat Mesiti-Miller

episodes.title: The Hunger Strike, Snap #611 - To The Brink
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
A young man in Northern Ireland volunteered for a mission of certain death. His family thought they were helpless to stop him. Find out more about Laurence McKeown’s work following the hunger strike www.aftermath-ireland.com www.healingthroughremembering.org


Producer: Anna Sussman

episodes.title: Snap #611 - To The Brink
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: 3,2,1..."To The Brink." Go to SnapJudgment.org to support Snap Storytelling. We are at the end. Help us get to 5,000 supporters. Thanks!

episodes.title: Snap Special - Twilight
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary: Bonus Snap Special, “Twilight.” It's an elusive moment in the magic hour featuring compelling performances by Shane Koyczan, Ise Lyfe, Sean Hayes and the legendary Moreese Bickham.

episodes.title: The Rapture, Snap #713 - Stranger In A Strange Land
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
“Even in the dirtiest environment, there will always be one small spot that is clean. The mark of every good investigative journalist is to identify that neat portion and use it to the benefit of society” - Anas Aremeyawa Anas

Check out the documentary “Chameleon” to see the whole story. The film was directed by Ryan Mullins and produced by Eyesteelfilm and you can rent or purchase it here 

To learn more about Anas and his extensive work, check out his website, www.anasaremeyawanas.org

 

Producer: Ana Adlerstein

Sound Design: Renzo Gorio

episodes.title: Kyabakura, Snap #713 - Stranger In A Strange Land
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Gavin arrived in Japan, he never expected his greatest liability to become his greatest asset.  


Producer: Joe Rosenberg

episodes.title: The Exit Interview - Jamie DeWolf, Snap #713 - Stranger In A Strange Land
episodes.author: Snap Judgment and WNYC Studios
episodes.summary:
When Jamie's friend attempts suicide, and fails, he is the one person she knows who can relate.

Performed live by Jamie DeWolf at Oakland's Paramount Theater

Music by Alex Mandel and Performed by Alex Mandel, Tim Frick, David Brandt
